properties.name: About Face
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsAll of the southbound traffic from the 101, which is a 3 lane freeway, was diverted to this road, which is a 1 lane highway. Traffic was backed up for miles as. A couple times, we remained stationary for 10 or 15 minutes, only to inch forward a few feet and wait again. After 90 minutes of this, and hearing that the 101 had been repoened, we did an illegal 3-point turn and went back to Buellton.

properties.name: Big Sur Campsite
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsBig Sur CampsiteThis is where we camped.

properties.name: Buellton
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsAs you drive up or down the 101, you\'ll notice some billboards advertising Andersen\'s Split Pea Soup, in Buellton. We weren\'t in the mood for peas, and we didn\'t see Andersen\'s, so we ate at Burger King instead. Little did we know that if we had gone a little farther, we could have eaten at Taco Bell, which was located right where we rejoined the 101.

properties.name: Buellton Taco Bell
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsBuellton Taco Bell

properties.name: Fork in the Road
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsThis is where they (the electronic highway signs) told us to get off the 101 and take the 154 instead. The 101 was blocked several miles south by a big accident reported in the LA Times story linked above.

properties.name: Home Sweet Home
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsOur camping gear was still wet and a bit muddy when we got it home. As any scout knows, that\'s no way to store a tent. So we had to unroll our tent and tarp, wipe them off in the bathtub and kitchen sink, and set the tent up in the living room to dry. Luckily, the room was just big enough.

properties.name: Huh.  Oxnard.
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsBefore there was even a town here, there was the Bernice Curren College of Animal Husbandry. They had the best bovine castration program in the country. No one who drove by could refrain from commenting on the huge piles of severed gonads. After a while, the name stuck.

properties.name: Oceano Dunes
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsWe meant to have lunch a little further north, at Pismo Beach, but we got off the 101 a little too soon and ended up having lunch here instead.

properties.name: Pfeiffer Big Sur Beach
properties.description: Posted by Btubbs  Half the sand on this beach is purple, and the other half a normal tan color. This makes for some fascinating swirly patterns created by the waves.

properties.name: Solvang
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsAs it was getting late, we wanted something to eat. Since we were already behind schedule, we wanted something fast. Since we had already eaten out twice that day, we wanted something cheap. Taco Bell was at the top of our list, but we couldn\'t find one in Solvang. It\'s too bad we didn\'t have more time to stay; the 18th was the first day of their Danish festival.

properties.name: The Scene of the Crime
properties.description: Posted by BtubbsBy the time we reached the place where they had closed the 101, there wasn\'t anything interesting left to see. All of the lanes on our side were open, but they were still down to just one coming from Santa Barbara. The traffic jam coming the other way stretched from here to the city.
